body:
Good idea.

Not too tricky - fancy having a go?

I just browsed the source  to see how this all works...
I'm not familiar with Go either, but I'll try, I think I get the idea where to start this little addition. :)

Just stumbled upon this feature searching for an "ignore Google Docs at all" feature.

Just to see if I got it clear: @okaresz is talking about ignoring Google Docs when syncing/copying files from one place to another or just about "deleting" Google Docs files if they are not present in the source location?

> Just to see if I got it clear: @okaresz is talking about ignoring Google Docs when syncing/copying files from one place to another or just about "deleting" Google Docs files if they are not present in the source location?

Ignoring them.  I'd imagine a flag `--drive-no-docs` which would stop rclone reporting the google docs in listings.

Exactly.
I'm also thinking of a next step, when gdocs are only synced (exported) one way (_from_ the drive). This requires that rclone recognizes the exported file belonging to the original gdoc. For example checking if the file name is the same and the extension respects the given `--drive-formats` switch.

This weekend I've got a bit of time to work on this.

@ncw, can you help me pointing out what doc files should I update for this new cmd line switch? :) I don't see which md files are auto-generated, or whether I should build/update the website as well with hugo, etc... (I haven't found any documentation about documentation :D)

@okaresz wrote
> can you help me pointing out what doc files should I update for this new cmd line switch? :) I don't see which md files are auto-generated, or whether I should build/update the website as well with hugo, etc... (I haven't found any documentation about documentation :D)

You are right, I should write some docs on how the docs are built!

You should only need to edit `docs/content/drive.md` - everything else is auto created from that.

I make the full docs, the man page, website when doing a release.
I added a section in the docs about writing docs!  20c033b48442dfd866074aee6a0f2dd1e6a2abb6

thanks!
pull request with my proposal: #1076

Thanks for doing this @okaresz 

A beta with this feature is here

http://beta.rclone.org/v1.35-54-gff8f11d/ (uploaded in 15-30 mins)
Just tested it (1.35-54) and worked as expected. No more Docs exported and no more "cant copy gdocs files". My whole copy (both ways) became much faster. Thanks @okaresz!
I'm glad you found it useful :)
Awesome! The tag `--drive-skip-gdocs` works (it skips google doc)
